questions.question: What is on the Canadian flag?
questions.explanation: The Canadian flag features a stylized red maple leaf on a white square with red bars on either side.

questions.question: When was the current Canadian flag officially adopted?
questions.explanation: The current Canadian flag was officially adopted on February 15, 1965. This date is now celebrated as National Flag of Canada Day.

questions.question: What are Canada's official languages?
questions.explanation: Canada has two official languages: English and French. Both have equal status in Parliament, federal courts, and federal institutions.

questions.question: What is Canada's national anthem called?
questions.explanation: O Canada is Canada's national anthem. It was proclaimed as the official national anthem on July 1, 1980.

questions.question: What are the official symbols of Canada?
options: The beaver and the maple tree
The polar bear and the pine tree
questions.correctAnswer: The beaver and the maple tree
questions.explanation: The beaver and the maple tree are Canada's official symbols. The beaver appears on coins, stamps, and other official items.

questions.question: When is Canada Day celebrated?
questions.explanation: Canada Day is celebrated on July 1. It marks the anniversary of Confederation when the British North America Act united the colonies into a single country called Canada on July 1, 1867.

questions.question: What is the Maple Leaf Tartan?
options: The design of the Governor General's flag
questions.explanation: The Maple Leaf Tartan was declared an official symbol of Canada in 2011. Its colors represent the changing colors of the maple leaf through the seasons.

questions.question: What is Canada's national winter sport?
questions.explanation: Ice hockey is Canada's national winter sport. Lacrosse is Canada's national summer sport.

questions.question: What is Canada's national summer sport?
questions.explanation: Lacrosse was declared Canada's national summer sport in 1994. It was originally played by Indigenous peoples and is one of North America's oldest team sports.

questions.question: What is the significance of the poppy worn by many Canadians in early November?
options: It celebrates the arrival of spring
questions.explanation: The poppy is worn as a symbol of remembrance for those who died in military service, particularly during World War I. It is worn in the days leading up to Remembrance Day (November 11).

questions.question: What is the name of Canada's highest civilian honor?
questions.explanation: The Order of Canada is Canada's highest civilian honor, recognizing outstanding achievement, dedication to the community, and service to the nation.

questions.question: Which floral emblem represents Ontario?
questions.explanation: The white trillium is the official floral emblem of Ontario, appearing in provincial government symbols and logos.

questions.question: What are the official colors of Canada?
questions.explanation: Red and white are Canada's official colors, as shown on the Canadian flag and used in other national symbols.

questions.question: Which animal is featured on the Canadian quarter (25-cent coin)?
questions.explanation: The caribou (reindeer) is featured on the Canadian quarter (25-cent coin). The beaver appears on the Canadian nickel (5-cent coin).

questions.question: What is the meaning of the motto on Canada's coat of arms: 'A Mari Usque Ad Mare'?
questions.explanation: Canada's motto 'A Mari Usque Ad Mare' is Latin for 'From sea to sea', representing Canada's territory stretching from the Atlantic to the Pacific Ocean.

questions.question: What does the red maple leaf on the Canadian flag represent?
options: The blood of soldiers who died for Canada
The changing seasons and natural environment
questions.correctAnswer: The changing seasons and natural environment
questions.explanation: The red maple leaf on the Canadian flag symbolizes Canada's nature and environment, particularly the maple trees that change color in autumn.

questions.question: What is the official residence of the Prime Minister of Canada?
questions.explanation: The official residence of the Prime Minister of Canada is located at 24 Sussex Drive in Ottawa. Rideau Hall is the official residence of the Governor General.

questions.question: What is the significance of the inukshuk, a stone landmark built by Inuit?
options: It merely serves as a decoration
It acts as a spiritual place of worship
It serves as a directional marker and can symbolize 'someone was here'
It is only used to mark burial grounds
questions.correctAnswer: It serves as a directional marker and can symbolize 'someone was here'
questions.explanation: The inukshuk is a stone landmark used by Inuit for navigation, as a point of reference, a marker for travel routes, fishing places, or food caches. It symbolizes that humans have been present and has become a cultural symbol of the Canadian North.

questions.question: What Canadian symbol appears on the back of the Canadian one-dollar coin?
questions.explanation: The one-dollar coin features a common loon floating on water on its reverse side, which is why the coin is often called the 'loonie'.

questions.question: What is the Parliament Buildings' distinctive architectural style?
questions.explanation: The Parliament Buildings in Ottawa are built in the Gothic Revival style, featuring pointed arches, flying buttresses, and ornate decoration.

questions.question: What is the significance of the Peace Tower in Ottawa?
options: It was a gift from the United States
It commemorates Canadians who died in wars
questions.correctAnswer: It commemorates Canadians who died in wars
questions.explanation: The Peace Tower is a bell and clock tower in the centre of the Parliament Buildings that serves as a memorial to Canadians who died in wars, with a Memorial Chamber containing Books of Remembrance listing the names of fallen soldiers.

questions.question: What animal is featured on the Canadian nickel (5-cent coin)?
questions.explanation: The beaver, a symbol of Canada, appears on the Canadian 5-cent coin (nickel).

questions.question: Which of the following is the national sport of Canada in summer?
questions.explanation: Lacrosse was declared Canada's national summer sport in 1994. It was originally played by Indigenous peoples and is one of North America's oldest team sports.

questions.question: What floral emblem represents Alberta?
questions.explanation: The wild rose (Rosa acicularis) is Alberta's official floral emblem, adopted in 1930.

questions.question: When did 'O Canada' officially become the national anthem?
questions.explanation: 'O Canada' was proclaimed as Canada's national anthem on July 1, 1980, though it had been used as a patriotic song for a century before that.

questions.question: What animal is on the Royal Canadian Mounted Police badge?
questions.explanation: The badge of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) features a bison head, symbolizing the western plains where the force originated.

questions.question: Which symbol on the Canadian Coat of Arms represents England?
questions.explanation: The lion on Canada's Coat of Arms represents England, while the unicorn represents Scotland. The fleur-de-lis represents France, and the maple leaves represent Canadians of all origins.

questions.question: What is depicted on the reverse side of the Canadian two-dollar coin?
questions.explanation: The Canadian two-dollar coin (toonie) features a polar bear on its reverse side. The coin was introduced in 1996, replacing the two-dollar bill.

questions.question: What holiday commemorates the sacrifices of Canadian veterans?
questions.explanation: Remembrance Day, observed on November 11th, commemorates the sacrifices of Canadian veterans and those who died in military service.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a Canadian national symbol?
questions.explanation: The bald eagle is primarily a symbol of the United States, not Canada. Canada's official symbols include the beaver, maple tree, and the maple leaf.

questions.question: What does the yellow/gold color in the Canadian Maple Leaf Tartan represent?
options: The autumn color of the maple leaf
questions.correctAnswer: The autumn color of the maple leaf
questions.explanation: In the Maple Leaf Tartan, green represents the summer foliage of the maple tree, gold represents the autumn colors, red represents the maple leaf in fall, and brown represents the maple tree trunk.

questions.question: Which province has the shamrock as part of its provincial flag?
questions.explanation: The flag of Newfoundland and Labrador includes a stylized golden arrow pointing east, symbolically representing a better future, but also containing symbols of the province including a shamrock representing the Irish heritage of many Newfoundlanders.

questions.question: Who composed the music for 'O Canada'?
questions.explanation: Calixa Lavallée composed the music for 'O Canada' in 1880. The lyrics were originally in French, written by Sir Adolphe-Basile Routhier, and later translated to English by Robert Stanley Weir in 1908.

questions.question: What symbolizes the French monarchy on the flag of Quebec?
questions.explanation: The flag of Quebec (called the Fleurdelisé) features a white cross on a blue field with four white fleurs-de-lis, a symbol of the French monarchy from whom many Quebecers are descended.

questions.question: What is the symbol of the Senate of Canada?
questions.explanation: The ornate ceremonial mace is the symbol of the authority of the Senate of Canada. The Senate cannot sit unless the mace is present.

questions.question: Which provincial or territorial flag features the Union Jack?
questions.explanation: The flag of Manitoba features the Union Jack (British flag) in the canton and the provincial coat of arms on a red field.

questions.question: What are the official colors of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police uniform?
questions.explanation: The famous dress uniform of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) features a red serge tunic with gold accents and a wide-brimmed hat. This iconic uniform is known worldwide as a symbol of Canada.

questions.question: What popular Canadian dessert was declared an official food of Canada in 2001?
questions.explanation: The Nanaimo bar, a no-bake dessert consisting of a wafer crumb base, custard-flavored butter icing in the middle, and a layer of chocolate on top, was declared an official Canadian food by the National Post in 2001.

questions.question: Which province's flag features a golden lion holding a red maple leaf?
questions.explanation: New Brunswick's flag features a golden lion (representing its ties to Brunswick, Germany) holding a red maple leaf (symbolizing Canada) on a gold background with a Spanish galley ship at the top.

questions.question: What is the symbolic meaning of the three maple leaves on the Canadian Coat of Arms?
options: The three founding nations: British, French, and Indigenous
The three territories: Yukon, Northwest Territories, and Nunavut
The three branches of government: executive, legislative, and judicial
Canadians of all origins: English, French, and Indigenous, as well as later immigrants
questions.correctAnswer: Canadians of all origins: English, French, and Indigenous, as well as later immigrants
questions.explanation: The three maple leaves on the Canadian Coat of Arms represent Canadians of all origins - the English, French, and Indigenous peoples, as well as later immigrants who have contributed to Canada's development and growth.
